Ultimately, this crisis demonstrates that America's energy independence is critical to our national security‚Äîand it can't be accomplished by increased domestic oil production alone.

We must double-down on efforts to more efficiently use oil, and use more clean, renewable energy.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: We have the existing infrastructure‚Äîand oil and gas companies shouldn't exploit this crisis to keep production artificially low, hike prices and add to their record profits.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: If energy producers produced at the level before the pandemic today, it would more than make up for what the U.S. had imported from Russia.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: But rather than turning from one brutal authoritarian regime to another to satisfy demand, America‚Äôs domestic energy producers have an obligation to increase supply above pre-pandemic levels.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text:
A ban on U.S. imports of Russian oil is the right move. 

We must continue to put a squeeze on Russia‚Äôs economy and limit Vladimir Putin‚Äôs ability to wage this unprovoked and unjustified war on the Ukrainian people.

(1/5)

name: Rep. Greg Stanton

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text:
We are in the midst of the most perilous times in the history of our fragile democracy. But we are not powerless to stop it. 

The House has passed critical voting rights legislation to protect every American's access to the ballot box‚Äîit is up to the Senate to meet this moment.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: The Big Lie has been used as pretext all over the country‚Äîincluding Arizona‚Äîfor efforts to restrict access to the ballot, install elected officials willing to openly ignore the legal votes of the people, and to adopt ways to overturn the results of future elections.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text:
That day, the domestic terrorists failed. 

But it was the beginning of the Big Lie and a dangerous plot to overturn future elections. The fraudulent conspiracy that the election was anything but safe, secure and fair has infected politics at every level.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: I‚Äôll never forget the sacrifices that @CapitolPolice and @DCPoliceDept officers made that day. More than 100 officers were injured, and five tragically lost their lives in the days and weeks that followed.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: One year ago, a violent mob of domestic terrorists stormed the Capitol with a single goal: overturn a free and fair election‚Äîthe bedrock of our democracy.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: The road to peace remains a long one, but we can take the first step today by working toward an immediate cease-fire and rededicating ourselves to a better future for Israelis and Palestinians alike.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: And Israel‚Äôs leaders, including Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu so long as he remains in power, must hold far-right Israeli extremists accountable, actively work to calm tensions within the region, and seek a stronger future for Palestinians.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: Peace cannot happen as long as Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas, now 16 years into his ‚Äúfour-year term,‚Äù cancels election after election to hold onto power and lacks the legitimacy to negotiate an enduring peace.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: But peace cannot happen as long as Hamas calls for another genocide of the Jewish people, refuses to recognize Israel‚Äôs right to exist, and remains in power. Gaza‚Äîand all Palestinians‚Äîmust be freed from Hamas.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: The conflict in the Middle East, which has caused so much pain for Palestinians and Israelis alike, must be solved‚Äîand it must become a higher priority for the international community, including the United States.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: It is a terrible tragedy, though, that so many Palestinian civilians have lost their lives during this conflict. Hamas has a long and well-documented history of cruelly using innocent Palestinians as shields and hiding weapons stockpiles in schools, hospitals and neighborhoods.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: Several of Hamas‚Äôs top commanders have been neutralized, and its ability to carry out significant attacks in the near future has been diminished. That is a positive step.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: If the United States were attacked by terrorists, we would defend ourselves and Israel has the same right to do so‚Äîperiod. To suggest otherwise holds Israel to a different standard than is expected of any other nation.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: Hamas‚Äôs indiscriminate attacks have not only killed Jewish and Arab Israelis but even Palestinians they rule over as one-fifth of their rockets fall directly into Gaza.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: This latest round of cyclical violence escalated when Hamas‚Äôs terrorist regime in Gaza launched rocket attacks with the intent to kill Israeli citizens.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text:
It is time for an immediate cease-fire between Israel and Hamas, and I hope President Biden will actively work toward that goal.
https://t.co/M5nd8ey2YT

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: Getting this right isn‚Äôt all that hard. But it does take a willingness to embrace science and treat the COVID pandemic as something more than a PR crisis. It‚Äôs time for Arizona leaders to step up.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: 5. Modernize unemployment benefits. Many are still hurting from the harsh economic impact of the pandemic, and Arizona has the second-lowest unemployment safety net in the country. That‚Äôs unacceptable‚Äîthe Governor and legislature should take this on now.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: 4. Address the spread in nursing homes and long-term care facilities. Test weekly those who care for our most vulnerable to prioritize health care workers and their patients. If we don‚Äôt protect our most vulnerable first, we will fail in this fight.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: 3. Prioritize contact tracing. Arizona has just 5 percent of the number of contact tracers we need to track our spread and identify hotspots. More time has been squandered, but we have the resources to build an effective contact tracing defense. We need to get it done.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: 2. Continue to expand testing and speed up results. As infection rates rise, we need testing to be fast and readily available for free. More testing data will give us a clearer forecast of this virus and allow us to curb the spread.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: 1. Mandate masks statewide‚Äînow. I was the first to call for an Arizona mandate in June and it‚Äôs still necessary. Masks work and save lives‚Äîand they are essential to getting us on the path to a faster recovery.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: We're already seeing that #COVID19, like so many other public health epidemics, is disproportionately impacting lower income communities and communities of color. We have to make sure that the resources are reaching our residents as equitably as possible. Lives depend on it.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: I've been talking to the CEOs and providers from these health care centers, and they need PPEs and test kits just like our major hospitals and providers do. That's why we fought to make sure community health centers would receive their fair share in the CARES Act.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: These centers serve hundreds of thousands of patients. But they aren't necessarily equipped with the same resources as our hospitals and private practices. For example, many weren't able to access any National Strategic Stockpile supplies to keep doctors and patients safe.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: Health centers such as @nativehealthphx work to address the specific needs of our urban Indian population while remaining sensitive to Native American traditions. And most of the health centers in our district provide critical health care services in Spanish.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: Community health centers are often on the front lines of serving our most vulnerable populations. They provide essential health services to everyone, regardless of insurance or immigration status. They work hard to build trust in these communities so they can better serve them.

-Increased federal funds for Medicaid

üö≠address the new youth tobacco epidemic

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: The dramatic rise in the number of middle and high school students using e-cigarettes has reversed the progress made in recent decades to curb tobacco use by kids and teens. We must act now to prevent the loss of an entirely new generation to a lifetime of nicotine addiction.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: It's no surprise that 97 percent of kids and teens using e-cigarettes use flavored e-cigarettes. Flavors like Rocket Popscicle, Tropical Fruit, Watermelon Wave, Electric Lemonade, Gummi Bear, and Blue Raz are being marketed to reach younger and younger audiences.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: Today, more than 5.3 million young people are using e-cigarettes, including 1 in 4 high school students. That number skyrocketed by 3 million just in the last 2 years. E-cigarettes have very high levels of nicotine, putting kids at a high risk of developing nicotine addiction.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: But they also shared with me their new stark reality: Coming home with no paycheck in sight is hurting their families. Some are considering paying penalties to dip into retirement. name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: Despite the furloughs, despite the low morale for those forced to work without pay‚Äîmany of these individuals were most upset that the shutdown has stalled or halted the critical services they provide the American people. https://t.co/Fh2TkbV8HO

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: Several employees and service providers are looking ahead and realizing that the shutdown will disrupt their work plans and budgets for the rest of the year. The consequences they fear will fall back to our residents: from forgone airport safety trainings to wildfire prevention. https://t.co/VoPZOtOBqL

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: This afternoon I met with more than a dozen Arizonans affected by the government shutdown. Each described to me the ways in which they feel held hostage each day this shutdown continues‚Äîtheir stories were both heartbreaking and frustrating. https://t.co/IWRc0JHyJY

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: Next week, I will once again vote to re-open the government. We will continue to put forward constructive, reasonable and bipartisan solutions to end the shutdown and get our government working again for the American people.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: Nearly 90 percent of @DHSgov employees‚Äîthose on the front lines‚Äîare working without pay. 53,000 TSA employees, 54,000 ICE officers, and 42,000 Coast Guard active duty members. It‚Äôs immoral and it puts our safety at risk.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: The @USEEOC‚Äîthe agency that makes sure employees are protected from race, sex, religion, sexual orientation or gender discrimination‚Äîis closed. Mediations have been cancelled and pending cases are being suspended.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: Thousands of federal employees responsible for enforcing public health, safety, consumer rights and environmental laws are on furlough. Food safety is at risk, and the shutdown is creating a backlog of approvals for new innovative prescription drugs and medical devices.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: E-Verify has been unavailable during the shutdown, which means more than 750,000 private sector employers who rely on the service can‚Äôt use it to hire new workers and fill jobs. That‚Äôs just plain harmful to our economy.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: Most immigration judges are on furlough. Cases are essentially frozen. Our courts are already facing a massive backlog of 800,000+ pending cases, with new ones now rescheduled several years out. Considering the president‚Äôs posture on border security, this disruption is absurd.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: Grant payments from @TheJusticeDept are now in jeopardy. Domestic violence shelters across the nation‚Äîmany of which rely on federal grant funds each month‚Äîcould struggle to keep their doors open and be forced to turn away women and children.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: We‚Äôre about to enter the second month of this needless shutdown. Tomorrow, I‚Äôll meet with people in AZ who are directly feeling the negative impacts. But I want to take a moment to share how the shutdown‚Äôs effect on law enforcement and safety organizations is hurting people.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: Honored to learn this evening that I‚Äôll be serving on the House Judiciary Committee‚Äîa key assignment for Arizona as we work to reform our nation‚Äôs broken immigration system. I‚Äôm excited to get to work.

name: Rep. Greg Stanton
tweet_text: 24 days of this shutdown has left many American families wondering how they will cover their basic costs of living. We‚Äôve heard from a number of residents feeling scared and hurt, and who are asking us to restore certainty to their lives. Enough is enough. #EndTheShutdown
